processGroups.comments: Sends an email with context on the failure
processGroups.name: Email Notification-SMTP

labels.label:
To set up a new workflow: ---------------------------------------------- If a new table is created in analytics, set up the postgres equivalent of that table in camunda database.
Once done, copy-paste any of these existing processors and modify the table details.
--------------------- Make sure the new table has nifi_entry_id column. If not, use the following query.
------
alter table {tablename} add column nifi_entry_id serial;
------- nifi_entry_id is essential in recognizing which rows have already been read and not having this column will lead to the same row being read multiple times.

processGroups.comments: Sends notification to configured ms teams group. The webhook url can be configured in the variable MST_NOTIFICATION_WEBHOOK.

config.comments: This processor invokes the MS Teams notification webhook by posting a message card which contains the details of the error.

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

config.comments: This processor send out a Message Card to MS Teams which will contain the error details.

processors.name: Generate content body for Teams notification

processGroups.name: Microsoft Teams Notification

config.comments: Generates an UPDATE statement with the postgres data

This processor is exclusively set up for debugging.
This processor MUST be edited before starting.
Prior to starting this processor,
1) Update the Table Name field 2) Update the pid in the Additional WHERE clause field. 3) STOP after the read event is successful 4) Clear out the Table name and pid with a placeholder.
To allow time for Stopping the processor, the processor is configured to execute only every 10 minutes which should allow you to verify read and stop execution.
Adds contextual variables that includes the failure stage and error (if any) to help debug

This processor is exclusively set up for debugging.
This processor MUST be edited before starting.
Prior to starting this processor,
1) Update the Table Name field 2) Update the pid in the Additional WHERE clause field. 3) STOP after the read event is successful 4) Clear out the Table name and pid with a placeholder.
Because this is exclusive for debugging, a nifi_entry_id is not set up. To allow time for Stopping the processor, the processor is configured to execute only every 10 minutes which should allow you to verify read and stop execution.

processors.name: (Debug Workflow) Query Any Table - Edit before execution

config.comments: Insert vs Update query based on the rows returned by the "select pid from table" stage.
Writes to the analytics DB. Both INSERT and UPDATE are handled by this processor
The input to this processor is the data from the postgres table in avro format. This is converted to a JSON at this stage.
Delete from camunda postgres table the row corresponding to pid.

Retrieves the record in the table corresponding to the pid. Returns the row if a row exists. Otherwise, empty response.
This is crucial in determining whether the data should be an INSERT or an UPDATE.

processors.name: Select by pid from table in analytics

config.comments: Generates an INSERT statement with the postgres data
Retrieve the data (i.e., the postgres data) back from the cache

config.comments: Adds contextual variables that includes the failure stage and error (if any) to help debug
Adds contextual variables that includes the failure stage and error (if any) to help debug
Adds contextual variables that includes the failure stage and error (if any) to help debug
This processor is used to set the pid as an attribute to the flowfile so that the pid is easily available for reuse at different processors.
Adds contextual variables that includes the failure stage and error (if any) to help debug

Generate a DELETE query to delete the row corresponding this pid from the camunda postgres table.
We are using this processor to 1) set statement.type variable 2) generate the DELETE query
Why are we using this ExecuteScript?
The following PutDatabaseRecord processor unlocks certain options if we use the contextual variables which is not available when selecting a DELETE option in the processor.
Why do we need those options?
The PutDatabaseRecord processor does not give an easy approach for adding a WHERE clause. So, we are generating the delete query here programmatically.
Adds contextual variables that includes the failure stage and error (if any) to help debug

Store the contents of the flowfile in a cache because, the following ExecuteSQLRecord processor will rewrite the flowfile content with data from analytics db. Hence, we're storing this in cache so that we can retrieve it a few steps later for writing to analytics.

processors.name: Put flowfile in cache (for later use)
